flags.title: From CRAFT
flags.text: This project first appeared on the pages of CRAFT or on Craftzine.

guide.introduction: In this first of three DIY Bedroom videos, I show you how to paint a room, lay down Ikea click-together floor, and add trim to a baseboard.
guide.introduction_rendered:
In this first of three DIY Bedroom videos, I show you how to paint a room, lay down Ikea click-together floor, and add trim to a baseboard.

Tools
  • Dropcloth
  • Ikea Tundra click-together floor
  • Paint roller
  • Power Drill, Drill press, Dremel, shop tools, wrenches, hammers, etc., soldering iron.
  • paint brushes for priming & painting
  • paint scraper
  • screws, drill, saw, hammer
  • trim

lines.text: Remove all furniture, hardware, light switch covers, and nails from the wall. Spackle where necessary by pulling a scraper over any holes. Scrape until all excess spackle is removed and sand down if necessary.
lines.text_raw: Remove all furniture, hardware, light switch covers, and nails from the wall. Spackle where necessary by pulling a scraper over any holes. Scrape until all excess spackle is removed and sand down if necessary.

lines.text: Fill in any cracks in baseboards with wood filler in the same manner as you spackled. Allow to dry for several hours.
lines.text_raw: Fill in any cracks in baseboards with wood filler in the same manner as you spackled. Allow to dry for several hours.

lines.text: Tape the perimeter of your windows, ceiling, doorways, and the fan if you are painting the ceiling.
lines.text_raw: Tape the perimeter of your windows, ceiling, doorways, and the fan if you are painting the ceiling.

lines.text: Paint thin even coats, starting at the ceiling and working your way down. Ventilate the space and allow the first coat to dry overnight before starting the second. Pay special attention to corners and seams of the room to make sure you have full coverage.
lines.text_raw: Paint thin even coats, starting at the ceiling and working your way down. Ventilate the space and allow the first coat to dry overnight before starting the second. Pay special attention to corners and seams of the room to make sure you have full coverage.

lines.text: Choose a flooring. I went with Ikea Tundra click-together floor since this is a tiny room and we are renters. Do a few practice rounds to get the feel of the boards, then lay them down in a staggered brick formation. Our room is so tiny we didn't need to do this, but we suggest it to prevent buckling.
lines.text_raw: Choose a flooring. I went with Ikea Tundra click-together floor since this is a tiny room and we are renters. Do a few practice rounds to get the feel of the boards, then lay them down in a staggered brick formation. Our room is so tiny we didn't need to do this, but we suggest it to prevent buckling.

lines.text: Push the pieces together until they click. To give an extra push without damaging the board, put fabric or a tee shirt on the end and gently tap in with your hammer.
lines.text_raw: Push the pieces together until they click. To give an extra push without damaging the board, put fabric or a tee shirt on the end and gently tap in with your hammer.

lines.text: Custom measure and mark your boards for the size they will need to be. Cut the remaining boards to fit your room using a saw and wearing proper eye protection. Sand the edges with fine grain sand paper.
lines.text_raw: Custom measure and mark your boards for the size they will need to be. Cut the remaining boards to fit your room using a saw and wearing proper eye protection. Sand the edges with fine grain sand paper.

lines.text: To add trim to your room, measure and purchase the amount needed and paint it the desired color.
lines.text_raw: To add trim to your room, measure and purchase the amount needed and paint it the desired color.

lines.text: Custom cut each piece of trim to fit each wall of the room, and cut each end at a 45 degree angle to make the corners tidy.
lines.text_raw: Custom cut each piece of trim to fit each wall of the room, and cut each end at a 45 degree angle to make the corners tidy.

lines.text: To attach the trim, you will need a power drill and panel nails. Drill a pilot hole using a bit that is slightly smaller than your panel nail. Hammer the nail in through the trim and wall at a 45-degree angle.
lines.text_raw: To attach the trim, you will need a power drill and panel nails. Drill a pilot hole using a bit that is slightly smaller than your panel nail. Hammer the nail in through the trim and wall at a 45-degree angle.

lines.text: Move the furniture and art back into the room, and we are ready to add a headboard!
lines.text_raw: Move the furniture and art back into the room, and we are ready to add a headboard!

guide.title: DIY Bedroom Make-Over

tools.text: Power Drill, Drill press, Dremel, shop tools, wrenches, hammers, etc., soldering iron.
